org.taverna.server.master

Class TavernaServerSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.taverna.server.master.TavernaServerSupport

  • @ManagedResource(objectName="Taverna:group=Server-2.5.4,name=Webapp",
                 description="The main Taverna Server 2.5.4 web-application interface.")
public class TavernaServerSupport
extends Object
    Web application support utilities.
    Author:
    Donal Fellows

      • permitUpdate

        public void permitUpdate(@Nonnull
                         TavernaRun run)
                  throws NoUpdateException
        Test whether the current user can do updates to the given run.
        Parameters:
        run - The workflow run to do the test on.
        Throws:
        NoUpdateException - If the current user is not permitted to update the run.

      • permitDestroy

        public void permitDestroy(TavernaRun run)
                   throws NoDestroyException
        Test whether the current user can destroy or control the lifespan of the given run.
        Parameters:
        run - The workflow run to do the test on.
        Throws:
        NoDestroyException - If the current user is not permitted to destroy the run.

      • getPrincipal

        @Nonnull
public UsernamePrincipal getPrincipal()
        Gets the identity of the user currently accessing the webapp, which is stored in a thread-safe way in the webapp's container's context.
        Returns:
        The identity of the user accessing the webapp.

      • getRun

        @Nonnull
public TavernaRun getRun(@Nonnull
                                  String name)
                           throws UnknownRunException
        Obtain the workflow run with a particular name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the run to look up.
        Returns:
        A workflow run handle that the current user has at least permission to read.
        Throws:
        UnknownRunException - If the workflow run doesn't exist or the current user doesn't have permission to see it.

      • makeListener

        @Nonnull
public Listener makeListener(@Nonnull
                                      TavernaRun run,
                                      @Nonnull
                                      String type,
                                      @Nonnull
                                      String configuration)
                               throws NoListenerException,
                                      NoUpdateException
        Construct a listener attached to the given run.
        Parameters:
        run - The workflow run to attach the listener to.
        type - The name of the type of run to create.
        configuration - The configuration description to pass into the listener. The format of this string is up to the listener to define.
        Returns:
        A handle to the listener which can be used to further configure any properties.
        Throws:
        NoListenerException - If the listener type is unrecognized or the configuration is invalid.
        NoUpdateException - If the run does not permit the current user to add listeners (or perform other types of update).

      • getListener

        @Nonnull
public Listener getListener(TavernaRun run,
                                     String listenerName)
                              throws NoListenerException
        Obtain a listener that is already attached to a workflow run.
        Parameters:
        run - The workflow run to search.
        listenerName - The name of the listener to look up.
        Returns:
        The listener instance interface.
        Throws:
        NoListenerException - If no listener with that name exists.

      • getProperty

        @Nonnull
public String getProperty(String runName,
                                   String listenerName,
                                   String propertyName)
                            throws NoListenerException,
                                   UnknownRunException
        Obtain a property from a listener that is already attached to a workflow run.
        Parameters:
        runName - The ID of the workflow run to search.
        listenerName - The name of the listener to look up in.
        propertyName - The name of the property to fetch.
        Returns:
        The property value.
        Throws:
        NoListenerException - If no listener with that name exists, or no property with that name exists.
        UnknownRunException - If no run with that name exists.

      • getProperty

        @Nonnull
public String getProperty(TavernaRun run,
                                   String listenerName,
                                   String propertyName)
                            throws NoListenerException
        Obtain a property from a listener that is already attached to a workflow run.
        Parameters:
        run - The workflow run to search.
        listenerName - The name of the listener to look up in.
        propertyName - The name of the property to fetch.
        Returns:
        The property value.
        Throws:
        NoListenerException - If no listener with that name exists, or no property with that name exists.

      • getPermission

        @Nonnull
public Permission getPermission(@Nonnull
                                         TavernaSecurityContext context,
                                         @Nonnull
                                         String userName)
        Get the permission description for the given user.
        Parameters:
        context - A security context associated with a particular workflow run. Note that only the owner of a workflow run may get the security context in the first place.
        userName - The name of the user to look up the permission for.
        Returns:
        A permission description.

      • setPermission

        public void setPermission(TavernaSecurityContext context,
                          String userName,
                          Permission permission)
        Set the permissions for the given user.
        Parameters:
        context - A security context associated with a particular workflow run. Note that only the owner of a workflow run may get the security context in the first place.
        userName - The name of the user to set the permission for.
        permission - The description of the permission to grant. Note that the owner of a workflow run always has the equivalent of Permission.Destroy; this is always enforced before checking for other permissions.

      • getPermissionMap

        public Map<String,Permission> getPermissionMap(TavernaSecurityContext context)

      • unregisterRun

        public void unregisterRun(@Nonnull
                          String runName,
                          @Nonnull
                          TavernaRun run)
                   throws NoDestroyException,
                          UnknownRunException
        Stops a run from being possible to be looked up and destroys it.
        Parameters:
        runName - The name of the run.
        run - The workflow run. Must correspond to the name.
        Throws:
        NoDestroyException - If the user is not permitted to destroy the workflow run.
        UnknownRunException - If the run is unknown (e.g., because it is already destroyed).

      • updateExpiry

        @Nonnull
public Date updateExpiry(@Nonnull
                                  TavernaRun run,
                                  @Nonnull
                                  Date date)
                           throws NoDestroyException
        Changes the expiry date of a workflow run. The expiry date is when the workflow run becomes eligible for automated destruction.
        Parameters:
        run - The handle to the workflow run.
        date - When the workflow run should be expired.
        Returns:
        When the workflow run will actually be expired.
        Throws:
        NoDestroyException - If the user is not permitted to destroy the workflow run. (Note that lifespan management requires the ability to destroy.)

      • buildWorkflow

        public String buildWorkflow(Workflow workflow)
                     throws NoCreateException
        Manufacture a workflow run instance.
        Parameters:
        workflow - The workflow document (t2flow, scufl2?) to instantiate.
        Returns:
        The ID of the created workflow run.
        Throws:
        NoCreateException - If the user is not permitted to create workflows.

      • getInput

        @Nullable
public Input getInput(TavernaRun run,
                                String portName)
        Get a particular input to a workflow run.
        Parameters:
        run - The workflow run to search.
        portName - The name of the input.
        Returns:
        The handle of the input, or null if no such handle exists.

      • getListener

        public Listener getListener(String runName,
                            String listenerName)
                     throws NoListenerException,
                            UnknownRunException
        Get a listener attached to a run.
        Parameters:
        runName - The name of the run to look up
        listenerName - The name of the listener.
        Returns:
        The handle of the listener.
        Throws:
        NoListenerException - If no such listener exists.
        UnknownRunException - If no such workflow run exists, or if the user does not have permission to access it.

      • getEstimatedContentType

        @Nonnull
public String getEstimatedContentType(@Nonnull
                                               File f)
        Given a file, produce a guess at its content type. This uses the content type map property, and if that search fails it falls back on the Medsea mime type library.
        Parameters:
        f - The file handle.
        Returns:
        The content type. If all else fails, produces good old "application/octet-stream".

                    throws FilesystemAccessException
        Throws:

                             File file)

        Throws:
        FilesystemAccessException

      • getProfileDescriptor

        public ProfileList getProfileDescriptor(Workflow workflow)
        Build a description of the profiles supported by a workflow. Note that we expect the set of profiles to be fairly small.
        Parameters:
        workflow - The workflow to describe the profiles of.
        Returns:
        The descriptor (which might be empty).
